alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Henry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 3:08AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Henry and southwestern Bureau Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 308 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cambridge, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Galva around 320 AM CDT. Kewanee around 325 AM CDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 21 and 24, between mile markers 27 and 29, and between mile markers 33 and 43. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 28 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
